A4.text: The most common definition for the region's boundaries includes Algeria, Egypt, Libya, Morocco, Tunisia, and Western Sahara, the territory disputed between Morocco and the partially recognized Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic.

A5.text: The United Nationsâ€™ definition includes all these countries as well as Sudan.

A6.text: Algeria, officially the People's Democratic Republic of Algeria, is a country in the Maghreb region of North Africa.

A7.text: Algeria is bordered to the west by Morocco.

A8.text: Egypt is a country spanning the northeast corner of Africa

A9.text: Egypt borders Sudan to the south

A10.text: Egypt borders Sudan to the south.

A11.text: Libya borders Algeria to the west.
